description: Partial demolition of the rear elevation of the Town Hall building, demolition of the staircases to the rear of the building; removal of the part of the roof of the Town Hall to facilitate a proposed roof extension; internal works involving the partial removal of a lift shaft, partial removal of internal walls; and internal external alterations associated with the change of use and redevelopment of Acton Town Hall to provide 71 residential units, including the partial demolition of the rear elevation of the Town Hall building, retention of fatade fronting the High Street and Winchester street, roof extension to existing Town Hall, construction of five storey infill extension/attached block (fronting onto Salisbury Street); and associated external alterations, landscaping, refuse and cycle storage (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.  Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) DE_P_LG (1) Revision C, DE_P_L00 (1) Revision C, DE_P_L01 (1) Revision C, DE_P_L02 (1) Revision C, DE_P_L03 (1) Revision C, DE_P_L04 (1) Revision C, DE_S_01 Revision B, GA_S_02 Revision B, DE_E_01_02 Revision C, DE_E_03 Revision C, DE_E_04 Revision C, DE_E_05-06 Revision C, DE_E_07-08 Revision C, DE_E_09-10 Revision C, GA_E_01-02 Revision I, GA_E_03 Revision H, GA_E_04 Revision H, GA_E_05 Revision H, GA_E_07-08 Revision H, GA_E_09-10 Revision G, GA_SP, GA_P_LG (1) Revision J, GA_P_L00 (1) Revision J, GA_P_L01 (1) Revision L, GA_P_L02 (1) Revision L, GA_P_L03 (1) Revision J, GA_P_L04 (1) Revision J, GA_S_01 Revision D, GA_S_02 Revision D.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | Prior to the installation any external materials or finishes, samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in the application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development, to preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the listed building, in accordance with policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | Works pertaining to the Council Chamber and Sycamore Room to include drawings and method statements as appropriate shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and English Heritage. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To safeguard the special interest of the listed building, in accordance with policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | Demolition works shall not take place until a contract for the development has been let.  Reason:  To prevent premature demolition which would be detrimental to the visual amenity of the listed building and conservation area and adversely affect its character, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | Details of suitable precautions must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to secure and protect the interior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work, and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority. 	 Reason: To preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the listed buildings, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | The position, type and method of installation of all new and relocated services and related fixtures (for the avoidance of doubt including communications and information technology servicing), shall be specified in advance of any work being carried out, and the prior approval of the Council as local planning authority, shall be obtained wherever these installations are to be visible, or where ducts or other methods of concealment are proposed. Any works carried out shall be in accordance with such approval. Particular regard should be given to work affecting the following features or parts of the building; Installation of non-mechanical ventilation;   Reason: To preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the listed buildings, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | Details of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any work is begun, and the relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such details once approved:  a)	Specification of works of internal plaster repair or making good after removals b)	Specification of repairs to existing and installation of new wood paneling   Reason: To preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the listed buildings, in accordance with in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015). | No new plumbing, pipes, soil stacks, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building unless shown on the drawings hereby approved.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development, to preserve the special architectural and historic interest of the listed buildings, and safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area, , in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2015).
